titlestmt.author: Sean Parke

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-06-17 09:23:01 -0400.

repository.corpname: University of Hartford Archives & Special Collections

did.unittitle: Millard family Civil War diary and other materials

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to all researchers.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials in this collection may be protected by copyright law (U.S. Code: Title 17). Any use of the material which exceeds fair use requires permission from the copyright holder. Researchers are solely responsible for obtaining the proper permission(s) for their use of the material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of William S. Millard's Civil War diary, a letter Millard wrote to his mother, his certificate of membership for the 14th Regiment of the New York State Militia (which became New York's 84th Infantry Regiment), as well as a letter from Joseph Millard to his mother, a copy of an etching of Colonel Ellsworth, and a newspaper clipping (undated, but post-civil war).
